titleStmt.title: Epulæ Thyesteæ: or, The thanksgiving-dinner: where the Devill finds all, meat, cooks, guests, &c. Together with the city present. Also a short grace after a long dinner. And a God-speed.

notesStmt.note: Verse satire, in reference to the execution of Charles I and others.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 8th 1649"; 1648 crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
